title: Tricks for handling a constantly changing input and output

definitions.Target Network: A separate network used to estimate the target value, with the same architecture as the function approximator but with frozen parameters.

formulas: For every C iterations (a hyperparameter), the parameters from the prediction network are copied to the target network.
summary: The slide discusses the use of a Target Network in neural networks to handle constant input and output changes. It suggests using a separate network with frozen parameters to estimate the target value, which leads to more stable training.
